item.title: 沃尔玛首席执行官道格-麦克米伦（Doug McMillon）将退休，内部人士约翰-福纳（John Furner）被任命为最高负责人
item.description: 沃尔玛周五表示，首席执行官道格-麦克米伦（Doug McMillon）将于明年退休，并将由内部人士约翰-福纳（John Furner）接任新的最高负责人。【原文：Walmart said on Friday that CEO Doug McMillon will retire next year and will be replaced by insider John Furner as the new top boss.】

item.title: 红鸟资本撤回对英国《每日电讯报》的竞购
item.description: 总部位于美国的私人投资公司红鸟资本（RedBird Capital Partners）周五表示，已撤回对英国《每日电讯报》和《星期日电讯报》的出版商--英国电讯报传媒集团（Telegraph Media Group）5亿英镑（6.7105亿美元）的竞购。【原文：U.S.-based private investment firm RedBird Capital Partners said on Friday it has withdrawn its 500 million pound ($671.05 million) bid for Britain's Telegraph Media Group, the publisher of the Daily and Sunday Telegraph newspapers.】

item.title: 独家报道：Teamshares 将通过 T. Rowe Price 支持的 7.46 亿美元 SPAC 交易在美国上市
item.description: Teamshares是一家中小型企业采购商，该公司周五表示，将通过与Live Oak Acquisition Corp公司达成的一项7.46亿美元的空白支票交易在美国上市，该交易得到了投资巨头T.【原文：Teamshares, a buyer of small- to medium-sized enterprises, said on Friday it would go public in the U.S. through a $746 million blank-check deal with Live Oak Acquisition Corp backed by accounts advised by investment giant T. Rowe Price .】

item.title: 法院称，谷歌必须向德国比价平台支付 4.65 亿欧元赔偿金
item.description: 柏林一家法院裁定，谷歌必须向德国比价平台 Idealo 支付约 4.65 亿欧元（5.42 亿美元）的市场滥用赔偿金。【原文：Google must pay the German price comparison platform Idealo approximately 465 million euros ($542 million) in damages for market abuse, a Berlin court has ruled.】

item.title: 恩桥公司批准 14 亿美元项目，促进加拿大石油流向美国炼油厂
item.description: 加拿大管道运营商恩桥公司周五批准耗资 14 亿美元扩建其 Mainline 和 Flanagan South 管道，为加拿大重质原油进入美国中西部和墨西哥湾沿岸地区增加新的运力。【原文：Canadian pipeline operator Enbridge on Friday approved a $1.4 billion expansion of its Mainline and Flanagan South pipelines, adding new capacity for Canadian heavy crude into the U.S. Midwest and Gulf Coast.】

item.title: 特朗普兄弟支持的美国比特币公司季度收入翻了一番多
item.description: 美国比特币公司（American Bitcoin）由美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的两个儿子支持，周五公布的第三季度利润增长了一倍多，原因是全球最大数字资产的开采商和买家受益于利润率的扩大。【原文：American Bitcoin , backed by two of U.S. President Donald Trump's sons, on Friday reported a third-quarter profit that more than doubled as the miner and buyer of the world's largest digital asset benefited from wider margins.】

item.title: 风险情绪笼罩市场，比特币跌至六个月低点
item.description: 由于对美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）12 月降息的预期减弱，风险资产加速抛售，比特币周五的交易价格在六个多月以来首次跌破 96,000 美元。【原文：Bitcoin traded below $96,000 for the first time in over six months on Friday, as a sell-off in risky assets accelerated on fading expectations for a December rate cut from the U.S. Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 估值担忧导致美国股票基金流入量降至四周低点
item.description: 截至 11 月 12 日的一周内，美国股票基金的需求急剧降温，原因是投资者对人工智能推动的市场反弹的持久性以及 10 月份劳动力市场状况疲软的迹象越来越警惕。【原文：U.S. equity funds witnessed a sharp cooling of demand in the week through November 12 as investors grew wary about the durability of the artificial intelligence-driven market rally and indications of weakening labour market conditions in October.】

item.title: 顶级资产管理公司 DWS 警告称，如果美国限制美元进入，全球将面临风险
item.description: 欧洲最大的基金管理公司之一 DWS 的首席执行官告诉路透社记者，该公司的高管们正在考虑万一美国联邦储备委员会限制美元融资可能带来的影响。【原文：Executives at DWS , one of Europe's largest money managers, are thinking through the potential impacts in the unlikely event that the U.S. Federal Reserve limits access to dollar funding, the firm's CEO told Reuters.】

item.title: 聚焦：标准锂业在阿肯色州锂业竞赛中获得华盛顿州的支持
item.description: 标准锂业公司（Standard Lithium）与埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil）争夺成为首家在阿肯色州生产锂的公司，而阿肯色州是北美最大的电池金属供应地之一。【原文：Standard Lithium is getting a boost from Washington as it vies with Exxon Mobil to become the first company to produce lithium in Arkansas, a U.S. state containing one of North America's largest supplies of the battery metal.】

item.title: 全球投资者回撤，对科技估值和美国劳动力持谨慎态度
item.description: 截至 11 月 12 日的一周内，全球股票基金流入量大幅下降，原因是对技术估值捉襟见肘的担忧和美国劳动力市场状况疲软的迹象助长了风险厌恶情绪。【原文：Global equity fund inflows cooled significantly in the week to November 12 as worries about stretched technology valuations and signs of softening U.S. labour market conditions fuelled risk-off sentiment.】

item.title: 默克斥资 92 亿美元收购 Cidara Therapeutics，押注流感预防领域
item.description: 默克公司周五表示，将以近 92 亿美元的价格收购 Cidara Therapeutics 公司，从而获得一种用于预防流感的实验性药物。【原文：Merck will acquire Cidara Therapeutics in a nearly $9.2 billion deal, the companies said on Friday, gaining access to an experimental drug for flu prevention.】

item.title: 德意志银行投资部门首席执行官：人工智能泡沫担忧 "无从下手
item.description: 德意志银行旗下 1.1 万亿欧元（约合 1.3 万亿美元）资金管理公司 DWS 首席执行官告诉路透社，人工智能股票价值的爆炸式增长给全球市场带来了 "没有游戏规则 "的风险，人们越来越担心该行业正处于泡沫之中。【原文：The explosion in the value of artificial intelligence stocks poses risks to global markets for which there is "no playbook", the CEO of Deutsche Bank's 1.1 trillion euro ($1.3 trillion) money manager DWS told Reuters, amid growing concerns that the sector is in a bubble.】

item.title: 早间竞价买谣言，卖新闻
item.description: 迈克-多兰（Mike Dolan）和投资回报率团队周末兴奋地阅读、观看和收听的所有内容。【原文：Everything Mike Dolan and the ROI team are excited to read, watch and listen to over the weekend.】

item.title: 应用材料公司股价下跌，原因是美国严格的出口限制措施拖累了中国业务
item.description: 应用材料公司（Applied Materials）周五盘前股价下跌 5%，原因是这家芯片设备制造商预计，由于美国严格的出口限制措施，明年在中国的支出将减少。【原文：Applied Materials shares slid 5% before the bell on Friday as the chip equipment maker forecast reduced spending in China next year due to stringent U.S. export curbs.】

item.title: 欧盟委员会称 SAP 为解决欧盟反垄断调查作出让步
item.description: 欧盟委员会周五表示，作为为解决欧盟反垄断调查而提出的让步措施的一部分，SAP 已提出让客户更容易改用竞争对手的软件，澄清其收费依据，并取消其恢复收费。【原文：SAP has offered to make it easier for customers to switch to rival software, clarify the basis for its fees, and abolish its reinstatement fee as part of concessions proposed to settle an EU antitrust probe, the European Commission said on Friday.】

item.title: 继 "拉布布 "热潮之后，玩具制造商也在节日期间掀起 "盲盒 "热潮
item.description: 尽管美国消费者一直在寻找正宗的 Pop Mart Labubu，但竞争对手却在关键的假日购物季推出了自己更便宜、更容易找到的 "盲盒 "产品，以利用这种毛茸茸的迷你怪物引发的热潮。【原文：While U.S. consumers keep searching for an authentic Pop Mart Labubu, rivals are introducing their own cheaper, easier-to-find "blind box" products for the key holiday shopping season to capitalize on the craze sparked by the fuzzy mini monsters.】

item.title: 陆军部长称武器制造商 "欺骗 "美军购买昂贵装备
item.description: 美国陆军部长丹-德里斯科尔（Dan Driscoll）说，大型国防公司 "欺骗 "美国军方购买昂贵的装备，而这些装备本可以通过商业途径获得更便宜的价格。【原文：Large defense companies have "conned" the U.S. military into buying expensive equipment when cheaper commercial options would have been available, U.S. Army Secretary Dan Driscoll said.】

item.title: 法官将权衡德克萨斯州总检察长能否阻止 Kenvue 因泰诺而分红
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一名法官周五将考虑州总检察长肯-帕克斯顿（Ken Paxton）的诉求，阻止 Kenvue 向股东支付 3.98 亿美元的股息，并阻止 Kenvue 将泰诺推销为对孕妇安全的产品。【原文：A Texas judge on Friday will consider state Attorney General Ken Paxton's bid to block Kenvue from paying a $398 million dividend to shareholders and from marketing Tylenol as safe for pregnant women.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 胆小的科技股投资者转而从英伟达业绩中寻找下一步线索
item.description: 随着投资者对全球市值最大、华尔街人工智能交易核心企业英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp）季度报告的反应，科技股的动荡可能在下周加剧。【原文：Turbulence in technology stocks could ratchet higher in the coming week as investors react to the quarterly report from Nvidia Corp , the world's largest company by market value that is at the heart of Wall Street's artificial intelligence trade.】

item.title: 12月降息预期减弱，美国期货下跌
item.description: 在美联储官员的鹰派言论增加了市场对 12 月降息的疑虑之后，美国股指期货周五下跌，预示着华尔街将出现新一轮抛售。【原文：U.S. stock index futures dipped on Friday, signaling a fresh round of selloff on Wall Street after hawkish comments from Federal Reserve officials added to doubts about an interest rate cut in December.】

item.title: 长达数周的网络关闭后，捷豹路虎英国生产恢复正常
item.description: 捷豹路虎周五表示，在网络攻击迫使其英国工厂停工六周、扰乱供应链并导致该汽车制造商损失数亿英镑之后，其生产运营已恢复正常。【原文：Jaguar Land Rover said on Friday its manufacturing operations had returned to normal after a cyberattack forced a six-week halt at its UK plants, disrupting supply chains and costing the carmaker hundreds of millions of pounds.】

item.title: 瑞美贸易协定细节可能于周五浮出水面
item.description: 历峰集团（Richemont）董事长约翰-鲁伯特（Johann Rupert）表示，瑞士和美国之间可能达成的降低瑞士出口产品 39% 关税的协议细节最快可能在周五公布，但可能要在几个月后才能签署。【原文：Details of a potential deal between Switzerland and the United States to reduce the crippling 39% tariffs on Swiss exports could emerge as soon as Friday, but it may be months before it is signed, Richemont Chairman Johann Rupert said.】

item.title: 阿提哈德航空九个月利润增长 26%，客运收入猛增
item.description: 阿提哈德航空公司周五公布，由于客运和货运业务收入增加，九个月利润达到 17 亿迪拉姆（约合 4.63 亿美元），同比增长 26%。【原文：Etihad Airways reported a nine-month profit of 1.7 billion dirhams ($463 million) on Friday, up 26% year-on-year, driven by higher revenue in both its passenger and cargo businesses.】

item.title: 标准普尔将日产汽车评级从 BB 下调至 BB-
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司周五表示，由于日产汽车的盈利能力持续面临压力，该公司已将其信用评级下调一个等级，同时对这家日本汽车制造商的前景持负面看法。【原文：S&P Global Ratings said on Friday it has downgraded its rating of Nissan Motor's credit by one notch on continuing pressure on its profitability, while taking a negative view of the outlook for the Japanese automaker.】

item.title: 迪拜航展将展示西方喷气机订单，中国将首次亮相竞争者
item.description: 在下周举行的迪拜航展上，飞机延误、中国取代空客和波音的野心以及地缘政治紧张局势将与新喷气机订单争夺人们的注意力。【原文：Aircraft delays, China's ambitions to dethrone Airbus and Boeing , and geopolitical tensions will vie for attention with new jet orders at next week's Dubai Airshow.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，由于芯片短缺加剧，三星将内存芯片价格最高上调 60
item.description: 两位知情人士称，三星电子本月提高了某些内存芯片的价格--由于全球竞相建设人工智能数据中心，目前这些芯片供不应求--与 9 月份相比，涨幅高达 60%。【原文：Samsung Electronics this month raised prices of certain memory chips - now in short supply due to the global race to build AI data centres - by as much as 60% compared to September, two people with knowledge of the hikes said.】

item.title: 日本汽车工会组织誓言：尽管关税带来痛苦，但在工资要求上绝不退缩
item.description: 日本顶级汽车行业工会组织负责人周五告诉路透社，尽管美国关税严重拖累了该行业的收益，但该组织并不打算在明年的劳资谈判中降低工资要求。【原文：Japan's top automobile industry union group has no plans to scale back its wage demands at labour talks next year despite a heavy drag on the sector's earnings from U.S. tariffs, its chief told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: ACS 与贝莱德推出价值 20 亿欧元的数据中心合资企业
item.description: 西班牙 ACS 公司周五表示，该公司与贝莱德全球基础设施合作伙伴公司（BlackRock's Global Infrastructure Partners）成立了一家合资企业，将初步开发 20 亿欧元（23.3 亿美元）、1.7 千兆瓦的数据中心组合。【原文：Spain's ACS and BlackRock's Global Infrastructure Partners have created a joint venture to develop an initial 2 billion euro ($2.33 billion), 1.7 gigawatt portfolio of data centres, the Spanish company said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局称，Stellantis 将召回近 113,000 辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周五表示，克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特将召回112,859辆美国汽车，因为发动机内的碎片可能导致发动机故障或车厢起火。【原文：Chrysler-parent Stellantis is recalling 112,859 U.S. vehicles as debris inside the engine could cause an engine failure or compartment fire, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Friday.】
